course.subject: MECH
course.name: The Rise of Autonomous Robots
course.description: Fueled by the rise of artificial intelligence, robotic devices are envisioned to become an ubiquitous part of daily life. New technologies such as wireless communication, voice and visual understanding, and machine learning will enable the development of biologically-inspired cognitive humanoid robots. This course will give students with little or no technical background an enriched understanding about robots and how they will change society. Fundamental social, economic, and technological issues of a human-machine society will be identified and discussed. The learning process will be facilitated through demonstrative sessions, where students can observe, evaluate, examine, and interact with a variety of autonomous robots and humanoids. Guided by internal and external experts, students will focus on a specific social, business or technology issue based on their personal background and interest. Through experimentation with robot kits, they will identify and explore ways robotics and automation might impact our quality of life.

reviews.comment_content: Didn't learn anything from lectures. The textbook was only required in 2 homework but even then, the content wasn't really relevant and the professor didn't go through anything in class. The only thing I learnt was from my own research when I was trying to finish the homework and midterm. Final project was pretty much just bs presentation and report.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is really nice but talkative and goes off topic all the time. TAs didn't assist much through the group project.
reviews.comment_grading: Didn't get any scores until after final submission which meant there was no feedback and the marking criteria wasn't clear, though the mean for everything is high at around 8x.
reviews.comment_workload: Didn't expect so much essays and reading for a mech/elec course.

reviews.author: Silee
reviews.title: NEVER CHOOSE THIS COURSE!!!
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a waste of time and it should be called LANG1903. All of the lectures and tutorials are not related to midterm and final. You can skip all the lectures and neglect the lecture slides. They are useless. Although tutorials are also useless, but they take attendance so remember not to skip. (I REPEAT AGAIN: DONT TAKE THIS COURSE!!!)

The professor required us to buy the textbook but he just used some articles to let us do the synopsis (2 homework). I think it is a waste of money because I supposed he would discuss the content with us, but he didn't.

Midterm is a report and you can do it at home. The format is like IES which means you need to follow the guiding questions. You need to find the references on your own because the lectures can't help you at all.

The biggest irony is that you learn nothing about mechanical engineering, but your ability for reading comprehension and rephrasing will be improved significantly after finishing the homework. That's why I said this course should be called LANG1903 instead of MECH 1903.

For the final, it is a group project, which is making a 'robot' by VEX kits. There will also be a presentation and a report. You don't need to use any actuators and program it. Of course, you need to learn how to use VEX kits on your own.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is talkative, so that's why the lectures are full of nonsense. He just put some Youtube links on the slides and played them one by one.

The TAs are not good as well. One time they brought us to the Science Park for a tutorial. I thought they had booked some workshops or talks, but actually we just wandered around the building.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean of homework and midterm is extremely high (around 88/100).

Attendance 10%
Homework 20%
Report 30%
Project 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to submit one synopsis of article every week as homework. There are total 5 synopsises you need to do and the maximum length of them is 2 A4 pages each.

The maximum length of the midterm and the final report is 10 A4 pages. While you are struggling with your midterm, they have given you the next home and you need to submit both of them within one week. What a nightmare.

reviews.author: 871djclqnc
reviews.title: All of the contents in this review are antiphrases
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a waste of time and it should be called LANG1903. All of the lectures and tutorials are not related to midterm and final. You can skip all the lectures and neglect the lecture slides. They are useless. Although tutorials are also useless, but they take attendance so remember not to skip. (I REPEAT AGAIN: DONT TAKE THIS COURSE!!!)

The professor required us to buy the textbook but he just used some articles to let us do the synopsis (2 homework). I think it is a waste of money because I supposed he would discuss the content with us, but he didn't.

Midterm is a report and you can do it at home. The format is like IES which means you need to follow the guiding questions. You need to find the references on your own because the lectures can't help you at all.

The biggest irony is that you learn nothing about mechanical engineering, but your ability for reading comprehension and rephrasing will be improved significantly after finishing the homework. That's why I said this course should be called LANG1903 instead of MECH 1903.

For the final, it is a group project, which is making a 'robot' by VEX kits. There will also be a presentation and a report. You don't need to use any actuators and program it. Of course, you need to learn how to use VEX kits on your own.
reviews.comment_teaching: You will find that the lessons are interesting. Usually professor play some videos in the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Acceptable grading, which the only good thing of this rubbish course
reviews.comment_workload: The whole course does not have any exams. You are only required to do a midterm report and a final project. For the midterm project, you can write something about the autonomous car in some aspects like social, business and technology. For the final project, you need to make a robot. The aim of the robot is up to you. Lots of freedom. You don't need to make the robot moving by itself. Just do some simple prototype is okay.
